intro: Sacciolepis tenuissima, commonly known as the slender sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
